title: Jira
description: The Jira Cloud Platform REST API

fields.redirect_uri: The callback URL for your application

scopes.manage:jira-configuration: Take Jira administration actions (for example, create projects and custom fields, view workflows, and manage issue link types)
scopes.manage:jira-project: Create and edit project settings and create new project-level objects (for example, versions and components)
scopes.read:jira-user: View user information in Jira that the user has access to, including usernames, email addresses, and avatars
scopes.read:jira-work: Read Jira project and issue data, search for issues and objects associated with issues like attachments and worklogs
scopes.write:jira-work: Create and edit issues in Jira, post comments as the user, create worklogs, and delete issues

actions.description: Exchange the code passed to your redirect URI for an access_token
Exchange a refresh_token for an access_token

actions.title: application_properties.get
actions.description: Returns all application properties or a single application property.

key.description: The key of the application property.

keyFilter.description: When a key isn't provided, this filters the list of results by the application property key using a regular expression. For example, using jira.lf.* will return all application properties with keys that start with jira.lf..

permissionLevel.description: The permission level of all items being returned in the list.

actions.title: application_properties.id.put
actions.description: Changes the value of an application property. For example, you can change the value of the jira.clone.prefix from its default value of CLONE - to Clone - if you prefer sentence case capitalization. Editable properties are described below along with their default values.

id.description: The ID of the application property, for example jira.newsletter.tip.delay.days.
The key of the application property to update.

actions.title: application_properties.advanced_settings.get
actions.description: Returns the application properties that are accessible on the Advanced Settings page. To navigate to the Advanced Settings page in Jira, choose the Jira icon > Jira settings > System, General Configuration and then click Advanced Settings (in the upper right).

actions.title: applicationrole.get
actions.description: Returns all application roles. In Jira, application roles are managed using the Application access configuration page.

actions.title: applicationrole.key.get
actions.description: Returns an application role.

key.description: The key of the application role. Use the Get all application roles method to get the key for each application role.

actions.title: attachment.id.delete
actions.description: Deletes an attachment from an issue.

id.description: The ID of the attachment.

actions.title: attachment.id.get
actions.description: Returns the metadata for an attachment. Note that the attachment itself is not returned.

id.description: The ID of the attachment.

actions.title: attachment.id.expand.human.get
actions.description: Returns the metadata for the contents of an attachment, if it is an archive, and metadata for the attachment itself. For example, if the attachment is a ZIP archive, then information about the files in the archive is returned and metadata for the ZIP archive. Currently, only the ZIP archive format is supported.

id.description: The ID of the attachment.

actions.title: attachment.id.expand.raw.get
actions.description: Returns the metadata for the contents of an attachment, if it is an archive. For example, if the attachment is a ZIP archive, then information about the files in the archive is returned. Currently, only the ZIP archive format is supported.

id.description: The ID of the attachment.

actions.title: attachment.meta.get
actions.description: Returns the global attachment settings, that is, whether attachments are enabled and the maximum attachment size allowed.

actions.title: auditing.record.get
actions.description: Returns a list of audit records. The list can be filtered to include items:

from.description: The date and time on or after which returned audit records must have been created. If to is provided from must be before to or the result set will be empty.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum is 1000.

offset.description: The number of records to skip before returning the first result.

to.description: The date and time on or before which returned audit results must have been created. If from is provided to must be after from or the result set will be empty.

actions.title: avatar.type.system.get
actions.description: Returns a list of system avatar details by owner type, where the owner types are issue type, project, or user.

actions.title: comment.commentId.properties.get
actions.description: Returns the keys of all the properties of a comment.

actions.title: comment.commentId.properties.propertyKey.delete
actions.description: Deletes a comment property.

propertyKey.description: The key of the property.

actions.title: comment.commentId.properties.propertyKey.get
actions.description: Returns the value of a comment property.

propertyKey.description: The key of the property.

actions.title: comment.commentId.properties.propertyKey.put
actions.description: Creates or updates the value of a property for a comment. Use this resource to store custom data against a comment.

propertyKey.description: The key of the property. The maximum length is 255 characters.

actions.title: comment.list.post
actions.description: Returns the comments for a list of comment IDs.

ids.description: The list of comment IDs. Maximum of 1000 IDs can be specified. Required

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about comments in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

actions.title: component.post
actions.description: Creates a component. Use components to provide containers for issues within a project. Permissions required: Any of the following:

assigneeType.description: The nominal user type used to determine the assignee for issues created with this component. See realAssigneeType for details on how the type of the user, and hence the user, assigned to issues is determined. Can take the following values:

description.description: The description for the component. Optional when creating or updating a component.

leadAccountId.description: The accountId of the component's lead user. The accountId uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, 384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192.Optional when creating or updating a component.

leadUserName.description: This property has been deprecated in favour of leadAccountId due to privacy changes. See the migration guide for details.The username of the component's lead user. Optional when creating or updating a component.

name.description: The unique name for the component in the project. Required when creating a component. Optional when updating a component. Maximum length 255 chars.

project.description: The key of the project to which the component is assigned. Required when creating a component. Can't be updated.

actions.title: component.id.delete
actions.description: Deletes a component. Permissions required: Any of the following:

id.description: The ID of the component.

moveIssuesTo.description: The ID of the component to replace the deleted component. If this value is null no replacement is made.

actions.title: component.id.get
actions.description: Returns a component. Permissions required: Browse projects project permission.

id.description: The ID of the component.

actions.title: component.id.put
actions.description: Modifies a component. Any fields included in the request are overwritten. If leadUserName is an empty string ("") the component lead is removed. Permissions required: Any of the following:

assigneeType.description: The nominal user type used to determine the assignee for issues created with this component. See realAssigneeType for details on how the type of the user, and hence the user, assigned to issues is determined. Can take the following values:

description.description: The description for the component. Optional when creating or updating a component.

leadAccountId.description: The accountId of the component's lead user. The accountId uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, 384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192.Optional when creating or updating a component.

leadUserName.description: This property has been deprecated in favour of leadAccountId due to privacy changes. See the migration guide for details.The username of the component's lead user. Optional when creating or updating a component.

name.description: The unique name for the component in the project. Required when creating a component. Optional when updating a component. Maximum length 255 chars.

project.description: The key of the project to which the component is assigned. Required when creating a component. Can't be updated.

actions.title: component.id.relatedIssueCounts.get
actions.description: Returns the counts of issues assigned to the component. Permissions required: Permission to access Jira.

id.description: The ID of the component.

actions.title: configuration.get
actions.description: Returns the global settings in Jira. These settings determine whether optional features (for example, sub-tasks, time tracking, and others) are enabled. If time tracking is enabled, this method also returns the time tracking configuration.

actions.title: configuration.timetracking.delete
actions.description: Disables time tracking.

actions.title: configuration.timetracking.get
actions.description: Returns the time tracking provider that is currently selected. Note that if time tracking is disabled, then a successful but empty response is returned.

actions.title: configuration.timetracking.put
actions.description: Selects a time tracking provider.

key.description: The key for the time tracking provider (for example, JIRA).

name.description: The name of the time tracking provider (for example, JIRA provided time tracking).

actions.title: configuration.timetracking.list.get
actions.description: Returns all time tracking providers. By default, Jira only has one time tracking provider: JIRA provided time tracking. However, you can install other time tracking providers via apps from the Atlassian Marketplace. For more information on time tracking providers, see the documentation for the Time Tracking Provider module.

actions.title: configuration.timetracking.options.get
actions.description: Returns the time tracking settings. This includes settings such as the time format, default time unit, and others. For more information, see Configuring time tracking.

actions.title: configuration.timetracking.options.put
actions.description: Sets the time tracking settings.

defaultUnit.description: The unit of time that will be applied to logged time by default.

timeFormat.description: The format that will appear on an issue's Time Spent field.

workingDaysPerWeek.description: The number of days in a working week (for example, 5.5). This value is specified in days.

workingHoursPerDay.description: The number of hours in a working day (for example, 7.6). This value is specified in hours.

actions.title: customFieldOption.id.get
actions.description: Returns a custom field option. For example, an option in a cascading select list.

id.description: The ID of the custom field option. To find this ID, configure the custom field and edit its options in Jira. Click the option and its ID will show in the URL as the selectedParentOptionId parameter.

actions.title: dashboard.get
actions.description: Returns a list of dashboards owned by or shared with the user. The list may be filtered to include only favorite or owned dashboards.

filter.description: The filter applied to the list of dashboards. Valid values are:

maxResults.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. Maximum is 1000.

startAt.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

actions.title: dashboard.dashboardId.items.itemId.properties.get
actions.description: Returns the keys of all properties for a dashboard item.

itemId.description: The ID of the dashboard item.

actions.title: dashboard.dashboardId.items.itemId.properties.propertyKey.delete
actions.description: Deletes a dashboard item property.

itemId.description: The ID of the dashboard item.

propertyKey.description: The key of the dashboard item property.

actions.title: dashboard.dashboardId.items.itemId.properties.propertyKey.get
actions.description: Returns the key and value of a dashboard item property.

itemId.description: The ID of the dashboard item.

propertyKey.description: The key of the dashboard item property.

actions.title: dashboard.dashboardId.items.itemId.properties.propertyKey.put
actions.description: Sets the value of a dashboard item property. Use this resource in apps to store custom data against a dashboard item.

itemId.description: The ID of the dashboard item.

propertyKey.description: The key of the dashboard item property. The maximum length of the key is 255 bytes.

actions.title: dashboard.id.get
actions.description: Returns a dashboard.

id.description: The ID of the dashboard.

actions.title: expression.eval.post
actions.description: Evaluates a Jira expression and returns its value.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

actions.title: field.get
actions.description: Returns all issue fields in Jira, both system and custom fields.

actions.title: field.post
actions.description: Creates a custom field.

description.description: The description of the custom field, which is displayed in the UI.

name.description: The name of the custom field, which is displayed in the UI. This is not the unique identifier.

searcherKey.description: The searcher defines the way the field is searched in Jira. For example, com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppickersearcher.The search UI (basic search and JQL search) will display different operations and values for the field, based on the field searcher. You must specify a searcher that is valid for the field type, as listed below (abbreviated values shown):

type.description: The type of the custom field. For example, com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppicker.

actions.title: field.fieldKey.option.get
actions.description: Returns all options defined for a select list issue field. A select list issue field is a type of issue field that allows a user to select an value from a list of options.

fieldKey.description: The field key is specified in the following format: $(app-key)__$(field-key). For example, example-add-on__example-issue-field.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. For example, 20.

startAt.description: The starting index of the returned objects. For example, 1.

actions.title: field.fieldKey.option.post
actions.description: Creates an option for a select list issue field.

properties.description: The properties can be any arbitrary key value pairs. These properties can be searched using JQL, if the extractions (see https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/modules/issue-field-option-property-index/) are defined in the descriptor for the issue field module.

value.description: The option's name, which is displayed in the UI.

actions.title: field.fieldKey.option.optionId.delete
actions.description: Deletes an option from a select list issue field.

fieldKey.description: The field key is specified in the following format: $(app-key)__$(field-key). For example, example-add-on__example-issue-field.

optionId.description: The ID of the option to be deleted. For example, 3.

actions.title: field.fieldKey.option.optionId.get
actions.description: Returns an option from a select list issue field.

fieldKey.description: The field key is specified in the following format: $(app-key)__$(field-key). For example, example-add-on__example-issue-field.

optionId.description: The ID of the option to be returned. For example, 3.

actions.title: field.fieldKey.option.optionId.put
actions.description: Updates an option for a select list issue field. If the option does not exist, a new option is created.

properties.description: The properties can be any arbitrary key value pairs. These properties can be searched using JQL, if the extractions (see https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/modules/issue-field-option-property-index/) are defined in the descriptor for the issue field module.

value.description: The option's name, which is displayed in the UI.

fieldKey.description: The field key is specified in the following format: $(app-key)__$(field-key). For example, example-add-on__example-issue-field.

optionId.description: The ID of the option to be updated. For example, 3.

actions.title: field.fieldKey.option.optionId.issue.delete
actions.description: Deselects a select list issue field option in all issues that it has been selected in. A different option can be selected to replace the deselected option. The update can also be limited to a smaller set of issues by using a JQL query.

fieldKey.description: The field key is specified in the following format: $(app-key)__$(field-key). For example, example-add-on__example-issue-field.

jql.description: A JQL query that specifies the issues to be updated. For example, project=10000.

optionId.description: The ID of the option to be deselected. For example, 3.

replaceWith.description: The ID of the option that will replace the currently selected option. For example, 2.

actions.title: field.fieldKey.option.suggestions.edit.get
actions.description: Returns options defined for a select list issue field that can be viewed and selected by the currently logged in user.

fieldKey.description: The field key is specified in the following format: $(app-key)__$(field-key). For example, example-add-on__example-issue-field.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. For example, 20.

projectId.description: Filters the results to options that are only available in the specified project. For example, 10000.

startAt.description: The starting index of the returned objects. For example, 1.

actions.title: field.fieldKey.option.suggestions.search.get
actions.description: Returns options defined for a select list issue field that can be viewed by the currently logged in user.

fieldKey.description: The field key is specified in the following format: $(app-key)__$(field-key). For example, example-add-on__example-issue-field.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. For example, 20.

projectId.description: Filters the results to options that are only available in the specified project. For example, 10000.

startAt.description: The starting index of the returned objects. For example, 1.

actions.title: filter.get
actions.description: Returns all filters. Deprecated, use Search for filters that supports search and pagination. Permissions required: None, however only the following filters are returned:

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

actions.title: filter.post
actions.description: Creates a new filter. The new filter is not shared and not selected as a favorite. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira.

description.description: A description of the filter (e.g., This filter returns open bugs for the Example project).

name.description: The name of the filter (e.g., Open bugs for Example project). Must be unique.

sharePermissions.description: The groups and projects that the filter is shared with. This can be specified when updating a filter, but not when creating a filter.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

actions.title: filter.id.delete
actions.description: Delete a filter. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira, however the following rules govern what a user can delete:

id.description: The ID of the filter to delete.

actions.title: filter.id.get
actions.description: Returns a filter. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission view the filter.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

id.description: The ID of the filter to return.

actions.title: filter.id.put
actions.description: Updates an existing filter. Use this method to update a filter's name, description, JQL, or sharing. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira, however the following rules govern what a user can update:

description.description: A description of the filter (e.g., This filter returns open bugs for the Example project).

name.description: The name of the filter (e.g., Open bugs for Example project). Must be unique.

sharePermissions.description: The groups and projects that the filter is shared with. This can be specified when updating a filter, but not when creating a filter.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

id.description: The ID of the filter to update.

actions.title: filter.id.columns.delete
actions.description: Reset the user's column configuration for the filter to the default. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.

id.description: The ID of the filter.

actions.title: filter.id.columns.get
actions.description: Returns the columns configured for a filter. The column configuration is used when the filter's results are viewed in List View with the Columns set to Filter. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission to view the filter.

id.description: The ID of the filter.

actions.title: filter.id.columns.put
actions.description: Sets the columns for a filter. Only navigable fields can be set as columns. Use Get fields to get the list fields in Jira. A navigable field has navigable set to true. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.

id.description: The ID of the filter.

actions.title: filter.id.favourite.delete
actions.description: Removes a filter as a favorite for the calling user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

id.description: The ID of the filter.

actions.title: filter.id.favourite.put
actions.description: Add a filter as a favorite for the calling user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

id.description: The ID of the filter.

actions.title: filter.id.permission.get
actions.description: Returns the share permissions for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission to view the filter.

id.description: The ID of the filter.

actions.title: filter.id.permission.post
actions.description: Add a share permissions to a filter. If you add a global share permission (i.e., all logged-in users or the public) it will overwrite all share permissions for the filter.Be aware that this method uses different objects for updating share permissions compared to Update filter. Permissions required: Share dashboards and filters global permission and the calling user must own the filter.

groupname.description: The name of the group to share the filter with. Set type to group.

projectId.description: The ID of the project to share the filter with. Set type to project.

projectRoleId.description: The ID of the project role to share the filter with. Set type to projectRole and the projectId for the project that the role is in.

type.description: The type of the share permission.Specify the type as follows:

id.description: The ID of the filter.

actions.title: filter.id.permission.permissionId.delete
actions.description: Deletes a share permission from a filter. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and the calling user must own the filter.

id.description: The ID of the filter.

permissionId.description: The ID of the share permission.

actions.title: filter.id.permission.permissionId.get
actions.description: Returns a share permission for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission to view the filter.

id.description: The ID of the filter.

permissionId.description: The ID of the share permission.

actions.title: filter.defaultShareScope.get
actions.description: Returns the default sharing settings for new filters and dashboards for a user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).

actions.title: filter.defaultShareScope.put
actions.description: Sets the default sharing for new filters and dashboards for a user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).

scope.description: The scope of the default sharing for new filters and dashboards:

actions.title: filter.favourite.get
actions.description: Returns the favorite filters of the calling user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

actions.title: filter.my.get
actions.description: Returns the filters owned by the calling user. If includeFavourites is true, the user's favorite filters are also returned. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

includeFavourites.description: Include the user's favorite filters in the response.

actions.title: filter.search.get
actions.description: Search for filters. This method is similar to Get filters except that you can refine the results to include filters that have specific attributes. For example, filters with a particular name. Permissions required: None, however only the following filters are returned (if no search parameters are set):

accountId.description: Returns filters with an owner that exactly matches accountId of the owner. This parameter cannot be used with the owner parameter.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

filterName.description: Returns filters with a name that partially matches filterName.

groupname.description: Returns filters that are shared with a group that has a name that exactly matches groupname.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. Max is 50.

orderBy.description: Orders the results by a property of the filter. For example, name.

owner.description: Returns filters with an owner that exactly matches owner. This parameter cannot be used with the accountId parameter.

projectId.description: Returns filters that are shared with a project that has an ID that exactly matches projectId.

startAt.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset). The base index is 0.

actions.title: group.delete
actions.description: Deletes a group.

swapGroup.description: The group to transfer restrictions to. Only comments and worklogs are transferred. If restrictions are not transferred, comments and worklogs will be inaccessible after the deletion.

actions.title: group.get
actions.description: This resource is deprecated, use group/member.

expand.description: List of fields to expand.

actions.title: group.post
actions.description: Creates a group.

name.description: The name of the group.

actions.title: group.member.get
actions.description: Returns all users in a group. Users are ordered by username.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of users to return per page.

startAt.description: The index of the first user to return.

actions.title: group.user.delete
actions.description: Removes a user from a group. Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission.

accountid.description: The accountId of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, 384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192. Required, unless username is specified.

username.description: This parameter has been deprecated due to privacy changes. Use accountId instead. See the migration guide for details.The username of the user. For example, admin. Required, unless accountId is specified.

actions.title: group.user.post
actions.description: Adds a user to a group.

accountId.description: The accountId of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, 384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192.

name.description: This property has been deprecated in favour of accountId due to privacy changes. See the migration guide for details.The username of the user. For example, admin.

actions.title: groups.picker.get
actions.description: Returns a list of groups whose names contain a query string. A list of group names can be provided to exclude groups from the results.

exclude.description: A list of groups to exclude from the result.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of groups to return. The maximum number of groups that can be returned is limited by the system property jira.ajax.autocomplete.limit.

query.description: The string to find in group names.

actions.title: groupuserpicker.get
actions.description: Returns a list of users and groups matching a string. The string is used:

avatarSize.description: The size of the avatar to return. If an invalid value is provided, the default value is used.

caseInsensitive.description: Indicates whether the search for groups should be case insensitive.

excludeConnectAddons.description: Indicates whether Connect app users and groups should be excluded from the search results. If an invalid value is provided, the default value is used.

fieldId.description: The custom field ID of the field this request is for.

issueTypeId.description: The ID of an issue type that returned users and groups must have permission to view. To include multiple issue type IDs repeat this parameter, use of a comma separated list is not supported. Special values, such as -1 (all standard issue types) and -2 (all subtask issue types), are supported. This parameter is only used when fieldId is present.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of items to return in each list. The maximum is 1000.

projectId.description: The ID of a project that returned users and groups must have permission to view. To include multiple projects repeat this parameter, use of a comma separated list is not supported. This parameter is only used when fieldId is present.

showAvatar.description: Indicates whether the user avatar should be returned. If an invalid value is provided, the default value is used.

actions.title: issue.post
actions.description: Creates an issue or, where the option to create sub-tasks is enabled in Jira, a sub-task. A transition may be applied, to move the issue or sub-task to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.

fields.description: List of issue screen field to update, specifying the sub-field to update and its value. This field provides a straightforward option when setting a single sub-field. When multiple sub-fields or other operations are required, use update. Fields included in here cannot be included in update.

historyMetadata.description: Details of issue history metadata. Deprecated.

properties.description: Details of issue properties to be add or update.

update.description: List of operations to perform on issue screen fields. Note that fields included in here cannot be included in fields.

updateHistory.description: Indicates whether the project in which the issue is created is added to the user's Recently viewed project list, as shown under Projects in Jira.

actions.title: issue.issueIdOrKey.delete
actions.description: Deletes an issue.

deleteSubtasks.description: Indicates whether the issue's sub-tasks are deleted when the issue is deleted.

issueIdOrKey.description: The ID or key of the issue.

actions.title: issue.issueIdOrKey.get
actions.description: Returns the details for an issue.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about the issues in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return for the issue. Use it to retrieve a subset of fields. Allowed values:

fieldsByKeys.description: Indicates whether fields in fields are referenced by keys rather than IDs. This parameter is useful where fields have been added by a connect app and a field's key may differ from its ID.

issueIdOrKey.description: The ID or key of the issue. For example, JRACLOUD-1549.

properties.description: A comma-separated list of issue properties to return for the issue. Allowed values:

adjustEstimate.description: Defines how to update the issue's time estimate, the options are:

comment.description: A comment about the worklog. Optional when creating or updating a worklog.

properties.description: Details of properties for the worklog. Optional when creating or updating a worklog.

started.description: The datetime on which the worklog effort was started. Required when creating a worklog. Optional when updating a worklog.

timeSpent.description: The time spent working on the issue as days (#d), hours (#h), or minutes (#m or #). Required when creating a worklog if timeSpentSeconds isn't provided. Optional when updating a worklog. Cannot be provided if timeSpentSecond is provided.

timeSpentSeconds.description: The time in seconds spent working on the issue. Required when creating a worklog if timeSpent isn't provided. Optional when updating a worklog. Cannot be provided if timeSpent is provided.

notifyUsers.description: Indicates whether users watching the issue are notified by email.

overrideEditableFlag.description: Indicates whether the worklog entry should be added to the issue even if the issue is not editable, because jira.issue.editable set to false or missing. For example, the issue is closed. Only connect app users with admin scope permission can use this flag.

reduceBy.description: The amount to reduce the issue's remaining estimate by, as days (#d), hours (#h), or minutes (#m). For example, 2d. Required when adjustEstimate is manual.

actions.title: version.post
actions.description: Creates a project version. Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission or Administer Projects project permission.

archived.description: Indicates that the version is archived. Optional when creating or updating a version.

description.description: The description of the version. Optional when creating or updating a version.

moveUnfixedIssuesTo.description: The URL of the self link to the version to which all unfixed issues are moved when a version is released. Not applicable when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.

name.description: The unique name of the version. Required when creating a version. Optional when updating a version. Maximum length 255 chars.

operations.description: If the expand option operations is used, returns the list of operations available for this version. Read only.

projectId.description: The ID of the project to which this version is attached. Required when creating a version. Not applicable when updating a version.

released.description: Indicates that the version is released. If the version is released a request to release again is ignored. Not applicable when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.

releaseDate.description: The release date of the version. Expressed in ISO 8601 format (yyyy-mm-dd). Optional when creating or updating a version.

remotelinks.description: If the expand option remotelinks is used, returns the list of remote links stored against this version. Read only.

startDate.description: The start date of the version. Expressed in ISO 8601 format (yyyy-mm-dd). Optional when creating or updating a version.

actions.title: version.id.delete
actions.description: Deletes a project version. Deprecated, use Delete and replace version that supports swapping version values in custom fields, in addition to the swapping for fixVersion and affectedVersion provided in this resource. Alternative versions can be provided to update issues that use the deleted version in fixVersion or affectedVersion. If alternatives are not provided, occurrences of fixVersion and affectedVersion that contain the deleted version are cleared. Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission or Administer Projects project permission.

id.description: The ID of the version.

moveAffectedIssuesTo.description: The ID of the version to update affectedVersion to when the field contains the deleted version. The replacement version must be in the same project as the version being deleted and cannot be the version being deleted.

moveFixIssuesTo.description: The ID of the version to update fixVersion to when the field contains the deleted version. The replacement version must be in the same project as the version being deleted and cannot be the version being deleted.

name.description: The name of the workflow scheme. The name must be unique. Maximum length 255 characters.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Indicates whether to create or update a draft workflow scheme when updating an active workflow scheme. An active workflow scheme is a workflow scheme that is used by at least one project. The following examples show how this property works:

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.delete
actions.description: Deletes a workflow scheme. Note that a workflow scheme cannot be deleted if it is active (that is, being used by at least one project).

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme. Find this ID by editing the desired workflow scheme in Jira. The ID will be shown in the URL as schemeId (for example, schemeId=10301).

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.get
actions.description: Returns a workflow scheme.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme. Find this ID by editing the desired workflow scheme in Jira. The ID will be shown in the URL as schemeId (for example, schemeId=10301).

returnDraftIfExists.description: Returns the workflow scheme's draft rather than scheme itself, if set to true. If the workflow scheme does not have a draft, then the workflow scheme is returned.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.put
actions.description: Updates a workflow scheme, including the name, default workflow, issue type to project mappings, and more. If the workflow scheme is active (that is, being used by at least one project), then a draft workflow scheme is created or updated instead, provided that updateDraftIfNeeded is set to true.

defaultWorkflow.description: The name of the default workflow for the workflow scheme. The default workflow has All Unassigned Issue Types assigned to it in Jira. If defaultWorkflow is not specified when creating a workflow scheme, it is set to Jira Workflow (jira).

description.description: The description of the workflow scheme.

issueTypeMappings.description: The issue type-project mappings, where each mapping is an issue type ID and project name pair. Note that an issue type can only be mapped to one project in a workflow scheme.

name.description: The name of the workflow scheme. The name must be unique. Maximum length 255 characters.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Indicates whether to create or update a draft workflow scheme when updating an active workflow scheme. An active workflow scheme is a workflow scheme that is used by at least one project. The following examples show how this property works:

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme. Find this ID by editing the desired workflow scheme in Jira. The ID will be shown in the URL as schemeId (for example, schemeId=10301).

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.createdraft.post
actions.description: Create a draft workflow scheme from an active workflow scheme, by copying the active workflow scheme. Note that an active workflow scheme can only have one draft workflow scheme at any given time.

id.description: The ID of the active workflow scheme that the draft is created from.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.default.delete
actions.description: Resets the default workflow for a workflow scheme. That is, the default workflow is set to Jira's system workflow (the jira workflow).

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Set to true to create or update the draft of a workflow scheme and delete the mapping from the draft, when the workflow scheme cannot be edited. Defaults to false.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.default.get
actions.description: Returns the default workflow for a workflow scheme. The default workflow is the workflow that is assigned any issue types that have not been mapped to any other workflow. The default workflow has All Unassigned Issue Types listed in its issue types for the workflow scheme in Jira.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme.

returnDraftIfExists.description: Set to true to return the default workflow for the workflow scheme's draft rather than scheme itself. If the workflow scheme does not have a draft, then the default workflow for the workflow scheme is returned.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.default.put
actions.description: Sets the default workflow for a workflow scheme.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Indicates whether a draft workflow scheme is created or updated when updating an active workflow scheme. The draft is updated with the new default workflow. Defaults to false.

workflow.description: The name of the workflow to set as the default workflow. For example, jira.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.delete
actions.description: Deletes a draft workflow scheme.

id.description: The ID of the active workflow scheme that the draft was originally created from.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.get
actions.description: Returns the draft workflow scheme for an active workflow scheme. Draft workflow schemes allow changes to be made to the active workflow schemes: When an active workflow scheme is updated, a draft copy is created. The draft is modified, then the changes in the draft are copied back to the active workflow scheme. See Configuring workflow schemes for more information.Note that:

id.description: The ID of the active workflow scheme that the draft was originally created from.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.put
actions.description: Updates a draft workflow scheme. If a draft workflow scheme does not exist for the active workflow scheme, then a draft is created. Note that an active workflow scheme can only have one draft workflow scheme at any given time.

defaultWorkflow.description: The name of the default workflow for the workflow scheme. The default workflow has All Unassigned Issue Types assigned to it in Jira. If defaultWorkflow is not specified when creating a workflow scheme, it is set to Jira Workflow (jira).

description.description: The description of the workflow scheme.

issueTypeMappings.description: The issue type-project mappings, where each mapping is an issue type ID and project name pair. Note that an issue type can only be mapped to one project in a workflow scheme.

name.description: The name of the workflow scheme. The name must be unique. Maximum length 255 characters.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Indicates whether to create or update a draft workflow scheme when updating an active workflow scheme. An active workflow scheme is a workflow scheme that is used by at least one project. The following examples show how this property works:

id.description: The ID of the active workflow scheme that the draft was originally created from.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.default.delete
actions.description: Resets the default workflow for a workflow scheme's draft. That is, the default workflow is set to Jira's system workflow (the jira workflow).

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme that the draft belongs to.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.default.get
actions.description: Returns the default workflow for a workflow scheme's draft. The default workflow is the workflow that is assigned any issue types that have not been mapped to any other workflow. The default workflow has All Unassigned Issue Types listed in its issue types for the workflow scheme in Jira.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme that the draft belongs to.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.default.put
actions.description: Sets the default workflow for a workflow scheme's draft.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Indicates whether a draft workflow scheme is created or updated when updating an active workflow scheme. The draft is updated with the new default workflow. Defaults to false.

workflow.description: The name of the workflow to set as the default workflow. For example, jira.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme that the draft belongs to.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.issuetype.issueType.delete
actions.description: Deletes the issue type-workflow mapping for an issue type in a workflow scheme's draft.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme that the draft belongs to.

issueType.description: The ID of the issue type.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.issuetype.issueType.get
actions.description: Returns the issue type-workflow mapping for an issue type in a workflow scheme's draft.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme that the draft belongs to.

issueType.description: The ID of the issue type.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.issuetype.issueType.put
actions.description: Sets the workflow for an issue type in a workflow scheme's draft.

issueType.description: The ID of the issue type. Not required if updating the issue type-workflow mapping.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Set to true to create or update the draft of a workflow scheme and update the mapping in the draft, when the workflow scheme cannot be edited. Defaults to false. Only applicable when updating the workflow-issue types mapping.

workflow.description: The name of the workflow. For example, jira.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme that the draft belongs to.

issueType.description: The ID of the issue type.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.workflow.delete
actions.description: Deletes the workflow-issue type mapping for a workflow in a workflow scheme's draft.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme that the draft belongs to.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.workflow.get
actions.description: Returns the workflow-issue type mappings for a workflow scheme's draft.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme that the draft belongs to.

workflowName.description: The name of a workflow in the scheme. Limits the results to the workflow-issue type mapping for the specified workflow.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.draft.workflow.put
actions.description: Sets the issue types for a workflow in a workflow scheme's draft. The workflow can also be set as the default workflow for the draft workflow scheme. Unmapped issues types are mapped to the default workflow.

defaultMapping.description: Indicates whether the workflow is the default workflow for the workflow scheme.

issueTypes.description: The list of issue type IDs.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Indicates whether a draft workflow scheme is created or updated when updating an active workflow scheme. The draft is updated with the new workflow-issue types mapping. Defaults to false.

workflow.description: The name of the workflow. For example, jira. Optional if updating the workflow-issue types mapping.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme that the draft belongs to.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.issuetype.issueType.delete
actions.description: Deletes the issue type-workflow mapping for an issue type in a workflow scheme.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme.

issueType.description: The ID of the issue type.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Set to true to create or update the draft of a workflow scheme and update the mapping in the draft, when the workflow scheme cannot be edited. Defaults to false.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.issuetype.issueType.get
actions.description: Returns the issue type-workflow mapping for an issue type in a workflow scheme.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme.

issueType.description: The ID of the issue type.

returnDraftIfExists.description: Returns the mapping from the workflow scheme's draft rather than the workflow scheme, if set to true. If no draft exists, the mapping from the workflow scheme is returned.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.issuetype.issueType.put
actions.description: Sets the workflow for an issue type in a workflow scheme.

issueType.description: The ID of the issue type. Not required if updating the issue type-workflow mapping.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Set to true to create or update the draft of a workflow scheme and update the mapping in the draft, when the workflow scheme cannot be edited. Defaults to false. Only applicable when updating the workflow-issue types mapping.

workflow.description: The name of the workflow. For example, jira.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme.

issueType.description: The ID of the issue type.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.workflow.delete
actions.description: Deletes the workflow-issue type mapping for a workflow in a workflow scheme.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Set to true to create or update the draft of a workflow scheme and delete the mapping from the draft, when the workflow scheme cannot be edited. Defaults to false.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.workflow.get
actions.description: Returns the workflow-issue type mappings for a workflow scheme.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme.

returnDraftIfExists.description: Returns the mapping from the workflow scheme's draft rather than the workflow scheme, if set to true. If no draft exists, the mapping from the workflow scheme is returned.

workflowName.description: The name of a workflow in the scheme. Limits the results to the workflow-issue type mapping for the specified workflow.

actions.title: workflowscheme.id.workflow.put
actions.description: Sets the issue types for a workflow in a workflow scheme. The workflow can also be set as the default workflow for the workflow scheme. Unmapped issues types are mapped to the default workflow.

defaultMapping.description: Indicates whether the workflow is the default workflow for the workflow scheme.

issueTypes.description: The list of issue type IDs.

updateDraftIfNeeded.description: Indicates whether a draft workflow scheme is created or updated when updating an active workflow scheme. The draft is updated with the new workflow-issue types mapping. Defaults to false.

workflow.description: The name of the workflow. For example, jira. Optional if updating the workflow-issue types mapping.

id.description: The ID of the workflow scheme.

actions.title: worklog.deleted.get
actions.description: Returns a list of IDs and delete timestamps for worklogs deleted after a date and time.

since.description: The date and time, in UNIX timestamp format, after which deleted worklogs are returned.

actions.title: worklog.list.post
actions.description: Returns worklog details for a list of worklog IDs.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about worklogs in the response. This parameter accepts properties that returns the properties of each worklog.

actions.title: worklog.updated.get
actions.description: Returns a list of IDs and update timestamps for worklogs updated after a date and time.

expand.description: Use expand to include additional information about worklogs in the response. This parameter accepts properties that returns the properties of each worklog.

since.description: The date and time, in UNIX timestamp format, after which updated worklogs are returned.
